Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

Q:

I want a small installation - do I need all of the files in the \redist directories?

A:

No, you only have to use the files that you intend to use. You have to have the main Miles library file (MSS32.DLL under Win32, for example), but the other files are optional.

If you aren't using any of the filters (or use the Dolby software 3D provider), then you don't need the MSSDSP.FLT file, for example.

Each of the M3D files are discussed in the 3D Digital Audio Services Section - if you aren't planning to support a particular 3D technology, just don't ship the corresponding M3D file.

The ASI files provide compression and decompression support in Miles. The MSSMP3.ASI file is the MP3 decoder. The MSSVoice.ASI, file contains the Voxware voice chat codecs. If you don't use one or more of these audio codecs, then you don't need to ship them!
